PerfectNetExp.abs: 阙字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 空缺;缺少。也作“缺”〖 beshortof〗 欠,应给而不给〖 owe〗 通“掘”。挖〖 dig〗.
字典中负字的解释 ... (13) 背弃,违背[ betray] (16) 欠债;欠缺;缺少[ owe;lack;be short of] (18) 失败[ fail in].

同等学力英语高频词速记 - 豆丁网 ... debt n. 欠款，债务 owe vi. 欠, 欠钱 industry n. 工业; 产业，行业; 勤奋.

phrase.cizu_name: owe it to oneself (to do something)

jx.jx_en_mean: need to do something to protect one's own interests
jx.jx_cn_mean: 为了自己有必要做某事

lj.lj_ly: you owe it to yourself to take care of your body.
lj.lj_ls: 为了你自己你必须爱护你的身体。

lj.lj_ly: thanks, I owe you one for this.
lj.lj_ls: 谢了，为这个我欠你的情。

jx.jx_en_mean: used to express disapproval of someone who expects to receive financial support or other benefits without doing any work
jx.jx_cn_mean: [用于对指望不劳而获的人表示不 满] …应该白白养活某人

lj.lj_ly: they think the world owes them a living.
lj.lj_ls: 他们认为这个世界应该白白养活他们。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English āgan 'own, have it as an obligation', of Germanic origin; from an Indo-European root shared by Sanskrit īs 'possess, own'. Compare with ought

entry.def: If you owe money to someone, they have lent it to you and you have not yet paid it back. You can also say that the money is owing .

example.ex: The company owes money to more than 60 banks...
example.tran: 这家公司欠下60多家银行的债。
布莱克已经欠他将近50英镑了。

entry.tran: 应把…归因（于）；应把…归功（于）
entry.def: If someone or something owes a particular quality or their success to a person or thing, they only have it because of that person or thing.

example.ex: I always suspected she owed her first job to her friendship with Roger...
example.tran: 我一直怀疑她仗着自己是罗杰的朋友才得到第一份工作。

example.ex: He owed his survival to his strength as a swimmer...
example.tran: 他是因为水性好才幸免于难的。

entry.def: If you say that you owe a great deal to someone or something, you mean that they have helped you or influenced you a lot, and you feel very grateful to them.

example.ex: As a professional composer I owe much to Radio 3...
example.tran: 作为一名职业作曲家，我十分感激第三电台。

example.ex: He's been fantastic. I owe him a lot.
example.tran: 他真是个大好人，我欠他太多了。

entry.def: If you say that something owes a great deal to a person or thing, you mean that it exists, is successful, or has its particular form mainly because of them.

example.ex: The island's present economy owes a good deal to whisky distilling...
example.tran: 该岛当前的经济发展主要归功于蒸馏法酿造威士忌酒行业。

example.ex: Mrs Allen's style of cooking owes much to her mother-in-law.
example.tran: 艾伦太太的烹饪风格很大程度上承传于她的婆婆。

entry.tran: 应该给予（某人感激、尊重、忠诚等）
entry.def: If you say that you owe someone gratitude, respect, or loyalty, you mean that they deserve it from you.

example.ex: Perhaps we owe these people more respect...
example.tran: 也许我们应该给予这些人更多的尊重。

example.ex: I owe you an apology. You must have found my attitude very annoying...
example.tran: 我应该向你道歉。你一定觉得我的态度很恶劣吧。

entry.tran: 应该为（某人做）；有必要为（某人做）
entry.def: If you say that you owe it to someone to do something, you mean that you should do that thing because they deserve it.

example.ex: I can't go. I owe it to him to stay...
example.tran: 我不能走。看在他的分上我也该留下来。

example.ex: You owe it to yourself to get some professional help...
example.tran: 你应该为了自己寻求专业人士的帮助。

entry.def: You use owing to when you are introducing the reason for something.

example.ex: He was out of work owing to a physical injury...
Owing to staff shortages, there was no restaurant car on the train.
example.tran: 由于缺人手，这趟火车上没有餐车。

means.word_mean: 1. be obliged to pay or repay
2. be indebted to, in an abstract or intellectual sense;

sentences.sentence: "This new theory owes much to Einstein's Relativity Theory"
"The thesis owes much to his adviser"

auth_sentence.content: Your heirs don't owe income tax on withdrawals.
auth_sentence.res_content: Your heirs don't owe income tax on withdrawals.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Your heirs don't owe income tax on withdrawals.

auth_sentence.content: We owe them an election where voters are inspired.
auth_sentence.res_content: We owe them an election where voters are inspired.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We owe them an election where voters are inspired.

auth_sentence.content: Then give me the five dollars you owe me.
auth_sentence.res_content: Then give me the five dollars you owe me.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Then give me the five dollars you owe me.

stems_affixes.word_buile: owe拥有→因为拥有[借]而欠;归功于

Sentence.sentence: When Beijing mentions in public the huge debts America owes China.
In her book No Exit: What Parents Owe Their Children and What Society Owes Parents, she argues that parents are burdened in many ways in their lives: there is "no exit" when it comes to children.

sentences.en: He paid me the ten dollars he owed me.
sentences.cn: 他已还了欠我的十美元。

sentences.en: You still owe so much debt.

means.word_mean: 应把…归功于，起因于，起源于

sentences.en: He owes his good health to plenty of exercise and a regular life.
sentences.cn: 他把他身体健康归功于运动和有规律的生活。

sentences.en: I owe it to you that I survived the catastrophe.
He gave me a lot of help.I owed much to him.
sentences.cn: 他给我许多帮助, 我非常感激他。

jushi.english: He paid me the ten dollars he owed me.
I owe you my best thanks.
